Reviews.Title: “Not such a good experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelerSP2010
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room in another hotel through Expedia. After a long flight from Chicago, I got there just to find out that the hotel did not have any rooms available! To make a long story short, a middle man brought me to Yunus Emre hotel and I told the person at the front desk about the situation. He said he has a room with three beds and asked for $150 for one night (I told him that I want to stay there for only one night and will decide whether I want to stay longer later). I agreed since I did not know the area and did not have any other choice. The next day after a good night sleep, I went walking around looking for another hotel. I found a much better room with 3 beds (I didn't ask for 3 beds; it was just there) in another hotel about 3 minutes walking distance from Yunus Emre for $50 a night. When I was checking out of Yunus Emre I told the front desk that what he did was not fair. His response was that customers negotiate for a lower rate and we do the opposite and ask for a higher rate whenever we can. He said this goes both ways and I should not be unhappy about it! This hotel is in a good location and is clean. However, the building is old (like many other buildings in the old town) and other than the bathroom and roof terrace (that is used for serving breakfast) there hasn't been much renovations. You'll get a gigantic key and key chain to your room, the TV and heating/cooling system is old, there is a small old elevator, ... With three beds in my room there was not much space left for luggage and I had to put my luggage on one of the beds. Overall, I think you can find a better hotel for the price nearby.

Reviews.Title: “basic, excellent value, nice people, great location, clean”
Reviews.Author: travellingsalesmen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times when in Istanbul - it is very basic, when I was there some of the guests were locals, I personally really liked the laid back come and go as you please atmosphere. They also picked me up from the airport free of charge. The location is perfect for sightseeing, it is not somewhere where you would look to stay for a romantic trip, but ideal for a value for money and clean base.

Reviews.Title: “feel like home”
Reviews.Author: Ebrahim H
Reviews.Content: this year we've been there a few nights in spring and summer like the past 3 years from our first Istanbul visit , we feel like home , very helping manager and stafs .

Reviews.Title: “Didn't love it...much better places nearby”
Reviews.Author: jaimemccallum
Reviews.Content: We got into Istanbul and decided to go to Hotel Yunus Emre because of their really good directions from the airport on their website. We got in and got a room. The room was TINY and I thought the floor was going to cave in. Breakfast was okay...basic, but they had a terrace so that was nice. The hotel staff didn't seem overly friendly or eager to help us find stuff to do. The next morning we wandered around the neighborhood and found a much better place with the same price. We promptly checked out and are now enjoying a much larger, cleaner more comfortable room. Use their directions to get to the neighborhood and then walk around and find a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: MagsNZ
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel I made sure I sent a message explaining that we'd be arriving at 5am so I had booked the night prior as well. When we got there they told us they thought we weren't coming and we were lucky they hadn't give our room away because everywhere in Istanbul was full that night. It then took 20 mins of explaining the arrival time and booking of the extra night because of it before we finally got to our room. The window was wide open, the room was freezing and the bathroom was dirty and smelt bad. In the mornings the walls were wet with condensation and the bathroom was right next to the breakfast room so the smell of eggs came through the air vent and made the whole room smell like eggs. Breakfast wasn't very good and when we ordered eggs they didn't make them for us. On the upside it was quite cheap and right next to the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “definetely not recommended”
Reviews.Author: ipoksane
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation trough venere. com which so far for me has been a reliable site. not anymore. so: I stayed in this hotel 5 nights and experienced the strangest "hospitality" ever. and this was my 14th visit to istanbul. after I checked in (they asked me to pay at the moment of check in and money payed was non-refundable) I was given a room in the 4th floor next to the kitchen. after spending there 10 minutes I asked to change a room because I could hear every single movement of every dish. so I was moved to room nr. 202. room was pretty ok, spacious, with pretty big batroom. in their website this hotel promises view form the terrace. maybe in summer season. and even then I believe you can see promised blue mosque only sitting in one corner of the terrace as long as you are not owl. it was cold so - no terrace. breakfast was ok. basic, but proper. when I came back to the hotel in the second day I realised the room was not put in the order. the same was in the third day. I asked in the reception, they promised to clean it up. so - THE ROOM WAS NOT PUT IN ORDER DURING ALL 5 DAYS OF MY STAY - no clean towels, no cleaned up bathroom and room, no waste taken out. and another one thing - nobody in the reception if you come to the hotel late at night. so basically I could choose to take any key. the website says there are safety boxes in the rooms. maybe there are, but in mine wasnt. inet - both times I asked if there is a possibility to use computer I got answer it is broken. regarding pictures on their website - there was a good photographer, reality is much more shabby. or those pictures were taken long time ago. so overall - the most impersonal hotel I have seen in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: 0007hot
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel for over two weeks and me and the children had a good time here.there is a computer wuth internet, good buffet breakfast and friendly staff. if you are looking for a good hotel with the basics:clean rooms, 24hr hot showers,perfect location and friendly staff,this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel, manager and staff is so friendly..We think that we are at home”
Reviews.Author: Kurtmen
Reviews.Content: We try to come every year..We love Turkey, and we stayed at Yunus Emre Hotel many times, each time we like it better. Very clean, very friendly, and most of all we feel very safe. Hotel is walking distance to everyting: Transportation, all important sites..You can not find better place in Istanbul far as the price, location , acomodations and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, extremely helpful & friendly staff, view of Bosphorus from roof,clean”
Reviews.Author: MomandKiki
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our teenager children. The hotel is very well located, around the corner from the Blue Mosque, in a pleasant area. Staff are friendly and really very helpful. The rooms were clean and well equipped. There is even free internet. Very much recommended. We had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location - Great value for your money - superb hospitality”
Reviews.Author: gallopingram
Reviews.Content: I have just read through reviews from last year and take exception to the whining and complaining of a few of last year's visitors. I stayed there on 4 occasions with small groups of over 50'travelers....and on EVERY occasion - everyone was totally happy with all aspects of the hotel...I am now booked back in April and June and have 8 clients staying there in May. I look forward to breakfasts on that fabulous patio over- looking the Marmaris ....and to fun take out meals from the DOY DOY Restaurant across the street....Sadly some tourists desire Four Season's quality for a typical local pension! Judy S-Kelowna BC

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyshores
Reviews.Content: Very basic, clean and enjoyable. Breakfast in the morning is included and served on roof top terrace where you can see beautiful vistas, Blue Mosque, Oblix and Bosporus Bay. Hotel staff is friendly and somewhat helpful. Main reason I stayed there was it's closeness to Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Topkapi Palace. Tram station and Sultan Ahmet shopping and restaurants are close bye. Doy Doy and Bohara Restaurants serving authentik Turkish foods are few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: mcnamaragio
Reviews.Content: Great service and location of the hotel. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - recommed to anyone”
Reviews.Author: yabraham
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really wonderful. Right in the middle of the Old City and right on the tram line for an easy escape to the rest of the city. The hotel was very clean, we had a double room with an ensuite bathroom. It was snug but perfectly adequate. The sheets were clean, and bathroom was fine. This hotel has a wonderful terrace on the roof where you can bring your bottle of wine and look out onto the sea and the Blue Mosque - purely magical. Staff were extremely helpful and there's a perfect little strip of restaurants and shops about 3 blocks away. I recommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at Yunus Emre”
Reviews.Author: hlongab
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights and couldn't have picked a better location for my first time in Istanbul, and at the right price. Located behind the Blue Mosque and walking distance to all the sights in Sultanahmet and beyond. The hotel was also on a quiet street. The rooms are basic and very clean. The walls are thin (thought the person snoring next door was in my room!) but nothing a pair of ear plugs won't fix. Breakfast on the terrace was good-bread, jams, honey, cheeses, olives, bolied eggs, tomatoes, cereal. Expect Nescafe rather than real coffee-that's just how it is. The call to prayer, being so close to the Blus Mosque, is hard to miss, but I found it quite beautiful and a highlight of my stay. The owners were almost always present and helpful. Across the street try restaurant Doy Doy, with inexpensive and delicious pide and shish kabob.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hostel!”
Reviews.Author: SmileyL
Reviews.Content: Above Average for a hostel: This is a hotel/hostel, and we stayed in the hostel portion. Originally we thought there were going to be 5 of us, and this seemed to be the perfect option. The place is extremely central. You walk out the front door and can see the Blue Mosque. The Aya Sofya is another minute away. The lobby was clean, the staff extremely helpful. There is free internet (granted it is a very old computer, but if you're patient, it works fine). Downside: The only downside is (in the hostel portion anyway) is that it smells like smoke. If you're allergic to cigarette smoke, this is not a good place. I am not sure how the other part of the hotel is. Also - might want to being sandals for the shower. We stayed in a 6 person dorm (which we had all to ourselves) and the shower is part of the bathroom. Meaning, the shower head is almost right over the toilet. Once the first person showers, everything is wet. Price: We paid 250 turkish liras for 2 nights, 6 beds. (This is about 150 dollars.)

Reviews.Title: “Customer service second to none!”
Reviews.Author: karenjg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Yusuf Emre for two nights when visiting Istanbul with my father. We were given a warm smiling welcome by the husband and wife team (Maria and Bulent) and were shown to our spotlessly clean rooms. We booked a tour through them, the guide was excellent, and they were very happy to give us all the information we needed to ensure we got the best out of Istanbul. At the end of our stay, I booked a shuttle to the wrong airport (entirely my fault). I didn't realise until we were there, when I told the drivers and there was a flurry of phone calls between Maria and the driver. Obviously time was running short and things were getting very tight, and I didn't have any Turksih currency left to get a taxi. Maria organised for the drivers (who should have gone back after this job) to turn around and drive us at truly terrifying pace across Istanbul to the other airport, a good hour away. She said not to worry about paying then, that I could wire the money when I got home. How's that for service, and trust? I have never witnessed such driving, and against all the odds they got us on our flight. Maria could have so easily washed her hands of us and said 'your problem' but she went out of her way to help us, and even paying for us, hoping we'd be honourable enough to settle up afterwards. My father and I are eternally grateful for her help and support - and for the terrifyingly brilliant driving we experienced! I felt like we were real people that they cared about, rather than just guests. I would stay there again in a shot. Thank you, Maria!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: susandrew
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Blue Mosque. Not fancy, but it worked for us, just over $100 per night. The manager was really nice, and helpful. Computers downstairs. The rooms were small, but fine. The rooftop terrace was great, and the breakfast staff were nice, food was good. It was quiet and pleasant. the Doy Doy restaurant was right across the street, handy, with good food.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location....”
Reviews.Author: luxury_backpackers
Reviews.Content: Small family run hotel in the heart of Sultahnamet. Recently refurbished but smallish rooms. Clean and not without it's charms. Short stroll to the blue Mosque and just off the main street of Sultahnamet. Included breakfast was OK without being fantastic. Overall, a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and helpful personnell”
Reviews.Author: GraceSlovakia
Reviews.Content: We were successful in finding a hotel in Istanbul which was worth the money they charged for B and B. Besides the good accommodation we met nice and helpful people running this hotel. We appreciated it while waiting for a shuttle to the airport in front of the hotel at the midnight. The young man who was in duty at the reception that night saw us standing outside the hotel and without being asked to do so, he came out and offered us a helping hand - he arranged for a car which took us to the airport and we did not miss our plane. We were grateful for this because I do not think it is absolutely natural in every hotel to help the visitors who in fact are not the visitors any more (we checked out at 11 a.m.). If we decide to go to Istanbul once more ( we have not seen all the beauty spots of this city so far) it is for sure we will find the way to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I do recommend”
Reviews.Author: Ma2008BR
Reviews.Content: I do recomend this hotel! IÂ´ve stayed in the hostel part and everything was just perfect! Clean bedroom, clean bathroom, hot water the whole day, EXTREMALLY helpful and friendly people, Bulent and Maria were always there to help you and ask you how was the day, always smiling and offering you a tea, helping you to find some places in the map... location is just PERFECT, price is pretty nice, they reserved transfers to the airport for me, EVERYTHING was much better than I could expect. I DID feel at home there! I can stay again there!!!! Easily! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Yunus Emre”
Reviews.Author: geanboy
Reviews.Content: As agreed, there was airport pick up to the Hotel which is a relieve if u are new to Istanbul. The hotel is clean & tidy. Breakfast was very good especially when the bread was warm with aroma. The location is fantastic if u are in Istanbul for the 1st time as all the major places of interest are within walking distance with Aya Sophia & the Blue Mosque just a 2 minutes stroll. Most of all i enjoy talking to the boss of the Hotel Mr Irem. He makes u feel at home. Do some walking and asking if you r on a budget and want to do your supermarket shopping. They are all there, but not very conspicuous.I enjoyed my stay at Yunus Emre as much as i enjoyed awesome Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “hard to beat yunus emre”
Reviews.Author: knaveboy
Reviews.Content: bulent and his wife maria run a fantastic hotel for this price range--they are wonderful hosts. the rooms are comfortable and well furnished, if somewhat spartan, and the close proximity to the blue mosque is hard to beat (as is the free breakfast on the terrace!). there is a free computer for guests in the lobby and wifi access in all rooms (though the best access seems to be in the lobby). i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yiannis73
Reviews.Content: After our ''Ipek Palace Disaster'' we were lucky enough to find a room in Emre. Rooms are quite small but clean, with big bathrooms and charming little balconies with great view. Excellent location, 5 minutes from Ayia Sofia, quiet at night. Only problem the open rooftop terrace which is wide open and canâ€™t be used in windy or rainy conditions and is the only place available for breakfast other than your room! Staff was polite and helpful. There are four other hotels next to Emre which all have protected roof terraces and larger rooms with same great views and same charge so I think Emre should lower its prices a little.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: arca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Yunus Emre in February. My family (husband two children 10-11) and I enjoyed the stay. The quadruple we booked was big enough, warm and clean, so was the bathroom. The breakfast was simple but for us it was ok. The owner arranged the pickup service at the airport on the arrival. Overall it was a pleasant stay and it was good value for money, we paid 65 euros (low season rate) for the room and the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Surprise”
Reviews.Author: j_gun55
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little gem. My family and I were left in the lurch due to another hotel overbooking but we were more thn happy with our change. Our room had a fantastic view and altough the room was a tad on the small side the room was very clean. The service was great as well with the staff being more than helpful. The rooftop terrace was fantastic for our evening meal. Overall a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “belated review but i must”
Reviews.Author: opec
Reviews.Content: stayed there back in July. felt like home. basic very clean rooms and hotel. best location. good prices. the roof top becomes your living room! view of marmara sea in front of you and several buildings behind you are the old city monuments. cafe across the street that starts playing live middle eastern melodies..hear great music for free (looked forward to waking up from late afternoon nap to the music.. (although music did get old on day 5 about :) befriend the workers there and feel like home.. bring you own food and prepare on roof top.. rooms air conditioning is excellent.. bath very good (although they forget to supply soap etc.. but no big deal) highly recommend it.. just do so homework on turkey. the old city neighborhood is fabulouse and quite. just do your shopping somewhere else, far away where the rest of turkey lives.. old city is expensive for groceries and resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for families! Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: sara14
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and 3 kids aged between 7 and 8+) chanced upon the Yunus Emre hotel when we were doing research on places to stay in Istanbul both in the Trip advisor and the Turkey Travel Planner. We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our travels and another 2 nights at the end. We had a family room with a double bed and 2 single beds. It was absolute value for money and its location couldn't be better. The hosts, Maria and Irem Bulent went out of their way to make us all feel welcome and at home. It was our first trip to Istanbul and apart from the reservations at the Yunus Emre we had very little else booked and they had arranged our pickup from the airport as well. We arrived in Istanbul on the night of the 1st after a 24 hour flight a little apprehensive about what awaited us. We need not have worried. Irem even kindly arranged for 2 bottles of water to be sent up to us from the nearby shop seeing how exhausted the kids and we were. We were shown straight to our room which was ready and super clean with plenty of hot water for all 5 of us to shower and we found the beds comfortable. The next morning we woke up and went up to the terrace to a beautiful view of the Marmara sea and the Blue mosque and a basic but hearty breakfast. We went walking around the Sultanahmet area and we were pleasantly surprised to realise how close we were to the action of Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace, Hagya Sophia etc and the exciting Ramadan bazaaar and other Sultanahmet attractions. We eventually made all our Turkey travel arrangements with their little travel agency with Maria who very kindly took into consideration that we were travelling with 3 young children. All the buses, hotels and tours she had arranged for us along the way were reasonably priced and the connections were quite seamless. The guides along our travels in Cappadoccia, Ephesus, Pamukkale and Troy were all excellent and we even had Mustafa Askin (he is the author of the book Troy and is mentioned in the Lonely Planet guide) guiding us in Troy on Beyram day. All in all the hotel was perfect for our needs and I would recommend the hotel to those looking for a clean, comfortable convenient hotel that offers value for money in the beautiful city of Istanbul! And did I add that it is also extremely close to the tram station? In fact on the way back we took the tram and metro for a grand sum of 3 liras on our journey to the airport!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Yunus Emre
HotelInfo.Address: Sifa /Hamami no:14 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
